ygData.subject: Re: Skill Changes
ygData.msgSnippet: You think that 8-10 hours is a bit much to gain a level??  I play about 20 hours a week (on average) and gain about 1-2 levels, which is about right... if it
ygData.messageBody:
You think that 8-10 hours is "a bit much" to gain a level?? I play about 20
hours a week (on average) and gain about 1-2 levels, which is about right...
if it was half that, then instead of being a level 22 now, I would probably
already be up to 50!

I kinda thought that most people level up pretty fast myself... hehe... Who
would have thought that just 3 months into this online game we would have
Level 50 players, and 4 months in, that we would have TONS of them, and many
more level 40+ players!!

I really didn't expect to reach level 50 for about a year (at 20 hrs a week
that is about right too, it seems) so I think things are pretty good
myself... I know many people are more interested in leveling up as fast as
they can, but tell me, what do you do after you have reached level 50 and
have played at that level for a month or more? I think I would get pretty
bored with it...
Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server
Proud member of Platinum Sphere Guild - www.platinumsphere.com



----- Original Message -----
From: Doug Sorensen <belgarth_of_surefall@...>
To: <EQCheats@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, July 26, 1999 3:30 PM
Subject: RE: [EQCheats] Skill Changes


> From: Doug Sorensen <belgarth_of_surefall@...>
>
> eqfeedback@... is the email address for
> feedback.
>
> I agree that level gaining is quite slow. 8-10 hours
> for a level is a bit much. I can't imagine the high
> 30s and above.
>
> Belgarth
>
> --- "Fling, Kirby" <FlingKirby@...> wrote:
> > From: "Fling, Kirby" <FlingKirby@...>
> >
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > >If Verant moves too far down this road EQ will
> > whither and
> > >die just like DR is. Then we will move on to the
> > next game
> > >until it gets too difficult to be fun anymore.
> > -----Original Message-----
> >
> > You have also hit that nail right on the head. I am
> > only a casual player,
> > and there have been many patches where I've felt a
> > bit shafted. They have
> > made EQ into a beast that requires absurd amounts of
> > time to make any
> > progress whatsoever. I used to have a great group
> > of people to party with,
> > but I couldn't dedicate the 40+ hours per week that
> > they did, so I'm enough
> > levels behind that I can't group with them and make
> > any progress... so I'm
> > stuck at a mid level and I haven't been able to find
> > another decent group
> > for the life of me. So instead of facing all the
> > frustration, I'm wishing I
> > could just switch my characters to "inactive"
> > status... where I can't play
> > the game, but they don't delete my characters.... so
> > I can come back in a
> > year or so if nothing better comes along.
> >
> > On the flip side, if EQ was just 50% easier, you
> > wouldn't be able to pry me
> > away from that infernal compter. It's the
> > excitement of making progress
> > that is so fun, and for the casual gamer, the
> > progress curve in EQ is so low
> > after lvl 20 that it's just not that much fun
> > anymore. I'd almost rather
> > spend my time playing Kingdoms or go back and play
> > Bladur's Gate all the way
> > through, or best of all... go find a good text-based
> > MUD where I can advance
> > at a reasonable speed then wiz and start adding my
> > own imagination to the
> > world.
> >
> > -Kzak
> >
> > P.S. does anybody know a email address for feedback?
> > I'd love to just share
> > some of these frustrations.
>
